p: The primary transmission is fecalâ€“oral, by person-to-person contact, or through ingestion of contaminated food/water. Parenteral transmission has been described but is rare. The risk of perinatal transmission is very small and transmission of the infection during the neonatal period is also rare. However, it has been described in neonatal intensive care units attributed to transfusion of contaminated blood or plasma and horizontal spread from infected persons [ 78, 79].
